meanings.def: to cause somebody/something to be in a particular state or condition
examples: Hundreds of people were rendered homeless by the earthquake.

meanings.def: to give somebody something, especially in return for something or because it is expected
examples: render something to somebody/something They rendered assistance to the disaster victims.
to render a service to somebody
render somebody something to render somebody a service
render something It was payment for services rendered.

meanings.def: to present something, especially when it is done officially
examples: The committee was asked to render a report on the housing situation.
He stood up and rendered a beautiful version of ‘Summertime’.
The artist has rendered the stormy sea in dark greens and browns.

meanings.def: to express something in a different language
examples: render something (as something) The Italian phrase can be rendered as ‘I did my best’.
render something (into something) It's a concept that is difficult to render into English.

meanings.def: to cover a wall with a layer of plaster or cement
to make fat liquid by heating it; to melt something
